p: Group 2: diphtheria in Bangladesh, Zika virus in Brazil and hepatitis A in Italy all shared similar characteristics: the number of cases were high, but the case–fatality rate was low. There were 218 931 people affected with Zika outbreak in Brazil with only 11 deaths. The outbreak duration of this group varied from 6 weeks to 18 months. Both Bangladesh and Brazil obtained international aid, while Italy managed the outbreak with their own resources.
